Maybe I should have been a bit clearer in my description, but my original issue was not meant as a question on how to fix the presented code (on the user side), but as code that I would have expected to work, but which did not.
As the Hook has a dedicated begin which is called in the correct graph, and supposed to do any modifications of that graph. So I think it is at least surprising that in this case the Saver is added during the __init__ and not the begin call.

body:
Maybe I should have been a bit clearer in my description, but my original issue was not meant as a question on how to fix the presented code (on the user side), but as code that I would have expected to work, but which did not. 
As the Hook has a dedicated `begin` which is called in the correct graph, and supposed to do any  modifications of that graph. So I think it is at least surprising that in this case the Saver is added during the `__init__` and not the `begin` call.
